result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Per WI Forensics, Dr Lundbohm is unable to conduct a competency evaluation.  Attorney Mcmahon was advised of the same and indicated the examination could be completed by a different Doctor through WI Forensics in addition to Dr Westendorf.  No amended Order necessary, per WI Forensics.  Attorney Brejcha has been advised as well.
Court appoints Dr Melissa J Westendorf and Dr Brooke E Lundbohm to conduct a competency evaluation.  Order signed by Judge Ramirez on 6/27/17.

Defendant Nicholas A Corso in court with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 8:54 am for hearing along with jury trial on 16CF1404.  Court addresses preliminary issues regarding the defendant's behavior in the jail this morning.  Attorney Mcmahon indicates her concerns with competency and harming himself, and is requesting an evaluation.  Attorney Brejcha makes statements to the Court and agrees with the examination.  Parties agree the competency will be as to all cases.  Parties have stipulated to the Doctor to do the evaluation.  COURT ORDERS A COMPETENCY EVALUATION PURSUANT TO SEC. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by Dr Melissa J Westendorf and Dr Brooke E Lundbohm.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  All proceedings are stayed.  Bail remains as fixed.  Review hearing scheduled for July 21, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
